data.title: Add IsSuicide to Explodes trait for kill credit
TD tooltip fixes

- Mention engineers will damage buildings, not just capture them.
- Removed whitespace before line breaks

reverted:
- Sentences are now (mostly) lowercase, end with full-stop.
- Changed "defence" tab tooltip to "defense".

data.title: Can't set waypoints for chrono tanks using shift
data.body:
Setting waypoints using shift doesn't work for chronotanks.
The tank chronos to the first waypoint and then does nothing, meaning it neither drives to the next waypoint nor waits until it can chrono again in order to chrono to the next waypoint.
According to penev in irc it may be due to teleporting cancelling all other activities.

Furthermore, waypoints also do not work if the tank has just chronoed and you're then issuing the waypoint order command using shift.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25682511-can-t-set-waypoints-for-chrono-tanks-using-shift?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: GlobalLightingPaletteEffect used in dune2000 Dark beacon
data.body:
If you are using these GlobalLightingPaletteEffect values at dune2k and move units arround, you will notice that the beacon that appears, at the positions where you clicked, are kinda too dark.
I guess this animation of the beacon is using a pal. that should not get manipulated.
I was unable to make a sreenshot, I tried alot but the  delay makes it impossible somehow. sry.

```
    GlobalLightingPaletteEffect:
        Red: 0.74
        Green: 0.64
        Blue: 0.49
        Ambient: 1.0
```

data.title: Lua scripted SupportPower subclass or Lua countdown clocks for SupportPowerTimerWidget
data.body:
Two ways:
- Lua scripted `SupportPower` subclass:
  - Requires `SupportPower` subclass trait on actor (can be Player, maybe World).
  - Can use other `SupportPower` features such as radar pings.
  - Can allow player to click to activate.
  - There will need to be a way for Lua code to link to the trait.
- Lua countdown clocks for `SupportPowerTimerWidget`:
  - Requires changes to `SupportPowerTimerWidget` to support two types of countdown timers.
  - Can use a simple Lua interface: `UserInterface.CreateCountdownTimer(DateTime.Minutes(10), function() ... end[, HSLColor.Blue])`.

Uses:
- Allies 02 - convoy clock.
- Monster Tank Madness - super tanks' self-destruct timer.
  - `UserInterface.CreateCountdownTimer(selfDestructCount, SelfDestruct, TimerColor)`
- Survival 01
- Survival 02

Uses (`SupportPower` subclass only):
- Custom support powers via Lua.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25671297-lua-scripted-supportpower-subclass-or-lua-countdown-clocks-for-supportpowertimerwidget?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: It is possible to build overlapping construction yards
data.body: This is in release and bleed. Select multiple MCVs that are separated by one cell from each other. Press F. They deploy simultaneously and construction yards overlap.

data.title: Mobile and Move refactor
data.body: Rebased and cleaned the rest from #7565.

data.title: TD Balance Additions.
data.body:
The following additions being added. Reference from http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17430&start=15  |||

Infantry: Detect cloak range 3 from 1. Evade chance 75 from 67.

MLRS: Price reduction 900 from 1200.

Repair Pad: power reduced 10 from 30. HP increased 600 from 400.

Samsite: cost reduced 650 from 750. Build time reduced 32 from 35.

Blue Tiberium: Value decreased 180 from 225.

Rocket Infantry: Damage vs armor increase 105 from 100

Apache and Orca: Price reduced 1100 from 1200. Build time reduced 27 from 29

Visceroids: Now move at a slower rate to prevent rush base attacks.

---

Let me know if I goofed yet again (As I did previously.)

data.title: Some more renaming from "race" to "faction"
data.body:
Yet another piece of #7873.
Split into nice small commits for easy reviewing.

I estimate another 2 or 3 PRs left after this one.

data.title: Repulsion prevents helicopters from landing on helipad
data.body:
When you have more than 1 helicopter selected and order them to enter a helipad, the heli who reserves the pad more often than not won't be able to land because repulsion from the surrounding helicopters prevents that.

data.title: Add Soviet07
data.body:
This is the 7th mission for the Soviet campaign. Following Issues remain:
- [ ] Dogs kill each other when attacking a Target at the same time [[#6798](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6798)]
- [x] Black tiles leave smudges [[#9049](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9049)]
- [x] Flame towers near goal are preplaced instead of spawning in (They spawn now like in the original)

Notes:                        
- Values for Barrel Explosions and attack range have been adjusted to mimic the original version.
- Dogs can't interact with objectives, you need either Soldiers or Engineers for that.

Compared to the original I've moved the trigger for disabling the security system to the Control Center, instead of disabling it when you free the Dogs.(At least that way it makes more sense to me)

data.title: Implement an openra-mod:// URI for installing third party mods from a website.
data.body:
Like #9027, but for mods.  Also depends on #8992 and #8991.  This would make it possible for third party mods to include an "Install for OpenRA" button on their websites.

The utility command should accept a url to the mod version/metadata file proposed in #9028 and then show a dialog with basic information (mod title / version / author) and a warning if there no compatible versions for the current version of OpenRA or if the latest version available is earlier than the indicated `LatestRelease`.  The command should download the mod to a temporary location, and then inspect its mod.yaml.  If it defines / includes any custom dlls it should show a prominent warning and then ask the player if they want to continue installing the mod.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25613878-implement-an-openra-mod-uri-for-installing-third-party-mods-from-a-website?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add mod browser support for querying third party mod versions.
data.body:
This feature has already been requested by our budding modding community, and is a rather obvious thing for us to include.

We can implement this in two stages:
1.  Implement a mod.yaml key pointing at a url with basic mod metadata and the latest mod version.  The mod browser should check this latest version, and display a notification if an update is required.
   Mod updates are initially handled manually outside OpenRA.
2. Add a `Versions` block with openra-version specific mod information, allowing OpenRA to update to the latest version that it supports via the mod browser.

The format of the remote metadata block could look something like:

``` yaml
Title: My super mod!
Author: My awesome mod team!
PreviewImage: http://my.domain/my/mod/preview.png
LatestRelease: 3.0
Versions:
    release-20170107:
        3.0: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion3.oramod
                Changelog: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion3.changelog
    playtest-20161224:
        2.9-alpha3: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion2.9alpha3.oramod
        2.9-alpha2: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion2.9alpha2.oramod
        2.9-alpha1: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion2.9alpha1.oramod
    release-20160715:
        2.0: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion2.oramod
                Changelog: http://my.domain/my/mod/mymodversion2.0.changelog
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25613739-add-mod-browser-support-for-querying-third-party-mod-versions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement an openra-map:// URI for installing maps from the resource center
data.body:
The ingame resource center integration works well for when you join a game with third party maps that somebody else has selected, but our process of exploring and discovering maps ourselves sucks.

We can solve this problem by creating a `--download-map <uid>` utility command, an `openra-map://<sha1>` URI that invokes it, and adding an "Install Map" button to the resource center pages.

The utility command should query the same `resource.openra.net/map/hash/<uid>/yaml` used by the ingame downloader, verify the map details (mod, whether it can be automatically installed, etc) and then either display an error or download and install the map.

The default output of the command should be human readable, and e.g. overwrite the progress line instead of outputting a scrolling list of percentages on newlines.

A `--porcelain` flag should output raw details in a format that can be easily consumed by a wrapper utility.  A `--map-info` or `--dry-run` flag should output the yaml from the api query without actively installing the map.  These two flags can be used by our Windows and OSX launchers to display a pretty native UI in front of the installation.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25613321-implement-an-openra-map-uri-for-installing-maps-from-the-resource-center?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Changed TimestampFormat for server logs
data.body:
Thanks for implementing the function in the first place :)

I'd like to change it to this pattern, because I got really confused when I opened my dedicated server window and all I saw was different numbers, there wasn't a lot of activity on my servers that day, so first I thought this was game timer or something, but with this it's easier to see exactly when things happen. This is also good for people who like to make scripts with "grep" and create stats out of that :)

data.title: Consolidate rules into ^Defense (all) & ^DeployedVehicle (ts)
data.body: Started by reducing the number of locations of `RenderRangeCircle` and `RenderDetectionCircle` since my `GenericWithRangeCircle` branch replaces them with a more generic (and thus more verbose) `WithRangeCircle` trait (requiring a `Type` and a `Color`).

data.title: Add a method to look up actors by ID.
data.body:
This can be used to speed up some methods.

In particular, this should remove the overhead of resolving IDs to actor when processing orders which should save anywhere up to 3% of CPU, as noted in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9008#issuecomment-129202470.

data.title: Sync only once per tick
data.body:
This greatly improves performance by not syncing the world state for every single order processed as this becomes very expensive, at the cost of being unable to directly pinpoint the order that causes a desync. Instead the granularity of detecting desyncs is reduced to the tick level.

As noted in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9008#issuecomment-129202470, in the worst case scenario of running a max speed replay with high orders rates (due to many players, particularly AI in this case), this could represent upto 50% of CPU!

Only syncing once per tick will benefit tick times when:
- Overall orders rates are high (e.g. due to many players or players with high APM (such as AI))
- An order is given to large groups of units (this should reduce the lag spike significantly)

The disadvantage is that in the event of a desync we won't know what specific order caused it, instead we will only know the frame the desync occurred in. This is hopefully a worthwhile tradeoff.

data.title: Refactor AI squads
data.body:
Our current squad system is way too random, gives us way too little control and causes way too many issues (see #9008 for a good example).

We should implement something more like this:

``` yaml
HackyAI:
  Squad@naval1:
    Name: naval1
    SquadType: Naval
    TargetScanRadius: 10
    ScanAroundActorTypes: NavalProduction
    MaximumSquadSize: 5
    MaximumCount: 1 # don't build this squad if there are already this many squads of this type
    Probability: 30 # probability that AI will decide to produce this squad (relative to other squads of this SquadType)
    ValidTargets: Water # only actively look for and move towards these target types
    SquadComposition:
      sub: 10%
      msub: 10%
      pt: 20%
      dd: 10%
      ca: 5%
    CompositionMaximums:
      sub: 5
      msub: 3
      pt: 5
      dd: 3
      ca: 2
  Squad@ground1:
    Name: ground1
    SquadType: Ground
    TargetScanRadius: 10
    ScanAroundActorTypes: BaseBuilder
    MaximumSquadSize: 15
    MaximumCount: 3
    Probability: 60
    ValidTargets: Ground
    SquadComposition:
      e3: 20%
      ltnk: 20%
      mtnk: 20%
      arty: 20%
      jeep: 20%
    CompositionMaximums:
      e3: 3
      ltnk: 3
      mtnk: 5
      arty: 3
      jeep: 2
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25551617-refactor-ai-squads?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
